Text: hey thanks for the upload, but i cant seem to get it to start. im using windows 7 so i ran as admin as stated in instructions. got the missing dll error, exited and tried again still didnt work. any ideas on what im doing wrong?
anyone else have the same problem?
nevermind problem solved! just ran it in windows 98 compatibility mode and it works now
hey THANX! one question though - works over Lan/Internet??? :)
awsome upload. works fine even on Win7 64bit, i just put it in the "programs x86" -folder and run as admin.
How do I run the windows 98 compatibility mode?

Hi

When I click the LAN button in the game main menu, nothing happens. Has anyone else had this problem or now what can be wrong? Joedude345 apperently did nog have the problem, so I wonder why, as I would love to play this game over LAN.

greetz

p.s. Thx for upload!

hi

Ok, I solved the problem by downloading the ipx wrapper. So now I have a menu, but I still don't see the other pc's. I runned the ipxrouter.exe. In the ipxconfig application, the ports also match. Any suggestions how to solve this?

Thanks a lot.

I finally solved the problem on my windows 7 system by applying this patch:

http://digiex.net/downloads/download-center-2-0/games/3423-tiberian-sun-red-alert-2-lan-patch.html

============================================
Tiberian Sun / Red Alert 2 LAN Patch
v1.00
by Scorpio9a 
============================================

.:: Release Notes ::.

This patch allows you to play TS and RA2 over LAN on Windows 2000 and above.
The patch makes use of the UDP protocol instead of IPX which no longer requires you to have IPX installed.

Supported Operating Systems by this release of the multiplayer patch:
Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows Server 2003, Windows Vista and Windows Server 2008.

For the latest version and tutorials check http://www.understorm.net/
Note: At the time of this post, this site wasnt working so we are providing a working mirror of the file.

.:: Installation ::.

Download Tiberian Sun / Red Alert 2 LAN Patch v1.0

Extract the files in your Tiberian Sun or/and Red Alert 2 directory.
